column4: I just completed my first ever build. I have an i7 2600k, 8600gt, 8gb g.skill ram, lots of fans, 3 sata hard drives. I installed Ubuntu 10.10 fresh after build, and now I'm having random program restarts/system freezes. I mean, more freezes within the last 2 hours than my other 5 years of linux combined. Any suggested culprits? I have a 600w PSU. I'm afraid that it isn't enough. Where should I start?
Note it only freezes/restarts programs when I'm doing something intensive, like encoding and listening to music.
not a clue.  I just know RAM can be bad when you buy it.  Always check RAM and cooling when you get weird crashes like that.
So if it is bad ram, I'll have to RMA won't I? I am entirely open to the idea though of my not knowing what I'm doing. First biuld.
How long would 8gb of ram take to test in BIOS?
Yeah you'll have to return it, and it will take a pretty good while
Ok, just wondering, because I have to finish this paper.
Should probably just limp along as best you can and check the ram tonight.

And oh yeah! I remember, when I killed X/gdm to install my nvidia driver, when I ran the ./Nvidia**.sh command, the first two times I tried I was getting some sort of "fault" error or so. Suggests ram I suppose doesn't it?
I think I remember seeing the word "segmentation".
Sound like it, but then again you said problems only show up under load which suggests heat.
Well, lm-sensors doesn't detect me newer motherboard, any ideas?
First time I ever set a CPU and heatsink, I am open to admitting I did something wrong.
reboot and look at the temps in bios after it gets unstable I guess?  I mean it's not going to be accurate, but it should be close enough.
I tried, 50*C....I guess in the freeze/reboot it cools pretty quick?
Just a thought, since I seem to be able to get the issue to present itself quickly (within 5 minutes), wouldn't a check at the BIOS level of memory present itself just as quickly?
